description: Some kind of prototypical electronic device with exposed wiring.  Some of the wires have bare ends that could be connected together.
A vintage, bright-red Bakelite phone of famous Swedish design.  It would look almost normal, if not for the fact that its rotary dial has been replaced with a doorknob.
A small, delicate golden comb.  It was once carefully engraved, but time has smoothed its designs to illegibility.
A smooth ring of steel, heavy under the weight of numerous keys.  The designs of the keys change over time, but none will fit any keyhole you have ever found.
A small cube of smooth rock.  A uniform grid of nine squares is engraved in each of its faces.
A squat teapot with a minimalist design.  Its surface shines under the glow of unseen light sources.
A small digital stopwatch, looking slightly old by today's standards.  Its digital display prints ever-changing gibberish.
A slightly worn button-down shirt with a tropical pattern, straight out of the 80's.  You swear that every time you look away and look back, the pattern changes subtly.
A strange golden badge in the shape of a shield with scratched out lettering.  The faceless figures decorating the badge seem taller and thinner than ordinary humans.
A pair of thin, round sunglasses.  The tinted glass seems to reflect the same shade of baleful orange light no matter what light it reflects.
A pair of ornately decorated steel scissors.  The handle is decorated with vicious-looking birds.
A heart-shaped silver locket with an black-and-white image of a smiling woman in it.  Her eyes seem to follow you whenever you look at it.
A jacket traditionally worn by school athletes.  The logo of the school has an oddly detailed fractal pattern that draws your eye in whenever you look at it.
A long apron with a plain pattern on it.  Your eyes can't seem to decide what color it is.
